intro: Haplostylis armeriifolia, commonly known as the slender-stemmed sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it forms dense clumps with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Haplostylis armeriifolia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support wetland biodiversity.
